Field Label: Was this child diagnosed with extrapulmonary tuberculosis or miliary tuberculosis on this admission?
Was this child started on tuberculosis treatment?

Did this child have a positive response to tuberculosis treatment after two months of treatment? Select the single best answer based on availability of follow-up data.

A positive response is defined as any of the following: resolution of a persistent, unremitting cough; resolution of weight loss or failure to thrive (recovery of weight with upward trending of weight growth curve, resolution of fevers, resolution of lethargy and/or return to baseline playfulness (improvement in activity level).
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, Yes | 0, No | 2, It has not been two months or greater since treatment started | 3, It has been two months or greater since treatment started but medical records do not indicate treatment response | 9, Unknown

Field Label: Is there documentation that non-infectious causes have been ruled out, such as foreign body as cause of the stridor?
Was a cause of the fever, other than malaria, identified?
